dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zipping fast down U.S. Route 70--West. We see the mileage both sides of the median indicating where they're coming where they're now going: from Baltimore, towards Frederic Maryland. (NOTE: this is shot on 16 or 35mm film, which w medium of "reality" for the rest of the movie.) The music that's blaring isn't underscoring--it's coming inside the Van. As is a WOMAN'S VOICE (ANNA) shouting ove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to turn that shit down just a hair??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON the Driver of the Van, a grunged-out 25 year old shoulder-length hair, a well-worn black "Blair Witch Proj shirt and cap: COTTER KALLER. He yells towards the backse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit? This is from "Josh's Blair Witch Mix," man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down or off--you're giving me a migraine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters) Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns the volume down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (petulant) Just trying to set the mood for the mission--get the "feeling."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only thing I'm feeling is homicidal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter grumbles. Then a wicked grin hits his lips. Turns unseen Man sitting next to him in the passenger seat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clamps Nick's hand on the steering wheel, picks up the Camcorder beside him, turns around, and starts shooting i back seat.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO CAMCORDER
dialogues.text: On a not-very-happy-at-the-moment-looking Blonde Woman.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA TASSIO
dialogues.text: age 20. She rolls her eyes as Cotter begins narrating:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bitched-out babe in back here is one Anna Tassio--we met one dark and stormy night in a Blair Witch chat room, we all did--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Christ almighty--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --but she was nicer then--sweeter-- she hadn't vomited twice already like today--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it's called "morning sickness," asshole--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (editorial aside) --a six week bun in the oven--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily) --Cotter, just turn the camera off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter responds by panning the Camcorder towards the pass seat. We see on video:

dialogues.speaker: NICK LEAVITT
dialogues.text: a lanky 21 year old wearing wire-rims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is her equally on-the-rag boy- friend, Nick Leavitt--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --turn the camera off--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --they're from UMass, doing some kind of fucking term paper--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Graduate Thesis--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --about the Witch--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --she doesn't exist--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --you got that right--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA pans again into the back seat, showing HEATHER 19, with a huge mane of fire-engine red hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and if she ever did--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --which she may have--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --bullshit--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --she wasn't a witch--we embrace nature, not evil--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --thank you, Heather Arendt--and arend't we glad you're here--a real witch--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --fuckin' A right--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Cotter--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a Wiccan--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --turn the goddamn camera off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camcorder swings back to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not making Blair Witch II here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One big blur of a pan--Cotter's turned the camcorder on h issues his manifesto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And let it be known--before we even get to Burkittsville--it's gonna be an eighteen thousand times better movie--for half the cost--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --which'd be about ten bucks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and unlike the first one, every second of it's gonna be true! "Blair Witch: The Real Story!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all going to be if you don't hit the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camcorder WHIP=PANS towards the windshield: The Van is about to plow into the rear of a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jee-zuz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visual pandemonium as the Camcorder goes flying from his down next to the

dialogues.speaker: BRAKE PEDAL
dialogues.text: We see both of COTTER'S FEET smash down on the pedal. Hea screeching of the passengers--screeching of the brake sho screaming of the tires as the Van swerves into the next l then an angry symphony of CAR HORNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a complete fucking idiot, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Graduate Fucking Thesis here was s'posed to be driving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drive, I'll handle the video, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the view from the Camcorder as it's scooped up fro floor and brought back up to eye-level again.

dialogues.speaker: ON NICK'S FACE
dialogues.text: As he waves two fingers at the lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and the Video zaps to black.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH BACK TO
dialogues.text: Where Nick can be seen tossing the camcorder into the bac Anna catches it, puts it in a back pack and zips it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. And the check's in the mail.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. THE VAN
dialogues.text: Doing a relaxed 35 down the narrow ribbon of Route 17. Ru country. The weather's turned grey--making all the 19th C vintage houses and barns they pass look dismal, if not a foreboding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheery little place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like traveling back in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good old days: toasting marsh- mallows over a burning witch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never burned witches in this country, they hanged them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever--all I know is the persecution's going to start all over again, they keep pumping out inflammatory bullshit like this fucking movie--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --hey: check that out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead of them, at a crossroads, is a sign: Welcome to Burkittsville

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Thought those all got stolen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess they thought it was safe to put some up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to slow the Van alongside the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody wanna hand me that claw hammer in back--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Nick pushes Cotter's leg back down on the accelerator. jerks past the sign and down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get busted on your own time. We've got a schedule to keep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter just glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it every day or just semi- weekly you got your ass kicked as a kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Now you can bring the vehicle to a stop: there on the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four of them stand there by the sign to the graveyard searching the gray horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She e-mailed me yesterday this is where we should meet her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatzername--the "psychic" Anna hired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini. Domini Von Teer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea, just talked to her on the 'Net--she's very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So says her website.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is--she's helped solve a bunch of murders: Arizona, New Mexico--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --how old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, probably right up there, based on her resume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there she blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter points to

dialogues.speaker: THE WOODS
dialogues.text: near the far edge of the cemetery. Standing there is an o and particularly Unattractive Woman, staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific--and I was afraid I wasn't going to get laid on this trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four of them start tromping towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not whatzername--it's Mary Brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From-the-movie-Mary-Brown, Trailer Park Bible Psycho?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for chrissake, she was an actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the kids were actors, the townspeople were real. Her, the Sheriff, the Convenience Store guy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --whatever; that's her.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: To the interview with Mary Brown from "Blair Witch Projec years have apparently not been kind: she looks a good two younger.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: They're less than 20 feet now from MARY BROWN. She speaks without expression:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just came over to say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's five bucks for signin' something; ten for signin' a Bible; twenty, you want to take a picture with me. Any kind've conversation, that's subject to negotiation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) I don't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks just the same. I think we're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather double-takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather. I saw her. Elly Kedward's hands were on her throat, and she was sucking out the girl's insides with her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Heather) Heather from the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Brown shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been a pleasure meeting you; we need to go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hustles the other three back towards the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it back--she wasn't an actor. She's a nutjob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what Josh and Mike said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: The cemetery. Everyone spread out looking for:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domino? Domini Von Teer...??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. And then, out of nowhere, seemingly just plunging r of the earth

dialogues.speaker: AN ARM
dialogues.text: extends into the air not far from them. Paper-pale and st almost skeletal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk over. See, lying atop a cracked granite marker, Young Woman who can't be more than 18. Heroin-chic skinny black, including her make-up--uber Goth: DOMINI VON TEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to find the energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the grave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To stand up--I'm exhausted. Been on the road since yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want amphetamines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter helps her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer and weed is what I've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna and Heather look at the faded marker Domini's been l It says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet place to take a nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk away, Heather sees Mary Brown across the cem staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. THE VAN
dialogues.text: Snaking its way down the road that wends through the Blac Hills.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Domini and her second beer have commandeered the shotgun relegated to a tight squeeze in the back seat. Dead silen slightly unnerving. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I hear you're from New Mexico!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her father's Sheriff of Taos County.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes. Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruins of the Rustin Parr house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy who killed all the kids in the '40s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("Outer Limits" tremolo) "The Voiiiiices made him do it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Witch's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't a witch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear voices all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That pretty much kills the rest of the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked at the edge of the woods. Back-packs being hauled rear, camping gear, video equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is all this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing dusk-till-dawn taping of all the places where there've been alleged Blair Witch "sightings" --the Parr House, Coffin Rock, Tappy Creek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what turns up--which I guarantee will be nothing. Some of the rest of the party are more hopeful--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --or incredibly fucking naive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, folklore--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --myth--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --doesn't just pop out of thin air. It spins off of real events. At some point there was a Blair Witch--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --or one huge attack of group hysteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snide) Either way, maybe there's a book in it, and they both make a ton of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping) It's a serious sociological study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four of you really have too much spare fucking time on your hands, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's your excuse for being here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I thought the movie was bitchin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mammoth backpacks strapped on, the five begin walks into forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a sec!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins and runs back towards the Van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the trees, they see Cotter place a pint of bottle the roof of the Van. Starts video-ing it as he walks away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He really is a fucking idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slogging up a 45-degree angled hill. This is not exactly Hillary and Co.--the five of them already look exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't we already do this hill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is staring at three different maps at once as he wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific: an hour, we're already lost--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and then a look of trepidation crosses Cotter's face--

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: Footage from "Blair Witch Project"--panic, as Heather, Jo Mike realize they've spent all day walking in a circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter?

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Nick's glaring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter looks up: less than 500 yards ahead can be seen th an Old House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --now there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Nick is pointing behind him. Cotter looks. From the ato he can see down to the road--and his Van with the water b the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the backpacks and miscellaneous tonnage is already du the ground. The five of them stretch their legs, massage shoulders and lower backs, while sightseeing the remnants old house and its environs. Cotter, not surprisingly, is taping everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a huge bite taken out of one of the walls of the foundati brick and soil strewn everywhere around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where they found the backpacks and all the film a year later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buried deep under 200 years worth of soil, ash, and compost layers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was a cluster-fuck for the mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it happened at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the camcorder image starts shaking wildly.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Cotter seen running full-tilt towards Heather, who's faci the interior foundation walls. He's jiggling the camera l got St. Vitus dance.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: We hear Cotter doing a passable Heather Donahue impressio screeching as the shaking video image PUSHES IN right tow Heather Arendt's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike! Miiiiiiike! Noooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather turns, scowling, and puts her hand over the lens.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Heather pushing the camcorder out of her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not only an idiot, you're a goddamn child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does everyone here but me have have a gigantic stick up their ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Check this out!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: On one of the foundation's interior walls: a gobbledygook handprints and strange, angular glyphs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at those marks--just like in the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ancient runes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --what the fuck's a "rune"?--

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Nick erasing half the marks with one sweep of his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --chalked just hours ago by ancient adolescents. It's called vandalism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All turn. She's pointing to the large, leafy tree with br stretching everywhere above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. What's it doing here in the middle of the foundation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Growing. This place burnt down 50 years ago. Trees happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick flips through a voluminous loose-leaf notebook--poin page to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look it's right here--from the Blair Witch "Dossier"--the sketch the anthropology students made of their dig when they found the backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sketch shows a spindly growth in the middle of the fo no more than six feet high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a sapling--this mother's got to be three hundred years old, minimum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sketch, Anna--it's not to- scale cartography; the tree was not the kids' focus--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --do you agree it's that old, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine, whatever, yes--it's an old tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just cut it down and count the goddamn rings--who cares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it means the tree is older than the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whoever built this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Nick rustles through the loose-leaf--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --brother of Rustin Parr's maternal grandfather, somewhere after 1858--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --whoever--they built an entire house around a tree. Sticking up right through the living room. Somebody like to explain that to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the family was crazy as Rusty Parr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon--even you have to admit this is weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--this is weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches down and picks one of the now infamous wooden men" off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER'S CAMCORDER
dialogues.text: Sudden, stunned silence as the camera examines it fore an And then Nick's hands are seen removing the material that the Stick Man's "arms" to his "torso." Torso and legs fal ground, leaving Nick holding a piece of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --sacred and occult Scotch Tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty Parr had the right idea on child care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By flashlight, Cotter's fiddling with five vid-cams on tr have already been set up. Domini lies within the foundation walls staring up at the Finishes the last of Cotter's beer and discards the empty Not far from there, Heather's already got her simple one- tent erected. Adjacent, Nick and Anna are wrestling with the nightmare to put up some Barnum & Bailey-size number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your parents didn't have a bigger one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was free--I recall that was the chief selling point for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense, sweetheart: fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Nick, you've been something of a total asshole the past few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me, I've had a few things on my mind--like putting this safari together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like how weirded-out you are with this pregnancy thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just leave it at: it was one hell of a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want it though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your body, your call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is there no "our" here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we take this up later--like indoors, without half the world listening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel no need to get married or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --fine, later, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonovabitch!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes turn: Cotter's standing 20 feet away with rotted tentpoles and a piece of grommeted canvas that's literall disintegrating in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hadn't even opened the thing since Cub scouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never would've guessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where the hell am I going to sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're looking at me, look elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the Panasonic Portable DVD player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me what I don't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather and Cotter jammed in there like Spam, sharing a j watching "Curse of the Blair Witch" on DVD: The Interview Sequence with folklorist CHARLES MOOREHOUSE explaining the "origins" of the Blair Witch story--Elly K banishment, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I never could figure about the movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three people: two guys, a girl-- sleeping in the same motel room, the same tent night after night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fucking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made no sense. Scared out of their minds, and the greatest stress reliever in creation right at their fingertips. Nada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sense at all. (beat) I'm a little stressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try a long walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't the Ritz, but they did come prepared: air mattre Coleman lanterns, a kerosene heater--and heaps of books a brimming file folders. They're sitting up in their respective mummy-style sleepi studying documents, making notes-- --when this high-pitched MOANING can be heard outside the Nick and Anna looks at each other. Nick grabs one of the and dashes for the tent door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shines the light slowly out into the foundation ruins- --and there's Domini, still lying on her back, staring up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh. Oooh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Domini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You planning on sleeping out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not planning on sleeping at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points up into the big oak in the middle of the found

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh. Oooh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The call comes back to her from the tree: "oooh-oooh." Nick sees perched high up on one of the branches: A GREAT OWL. It's staring down at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure I lie here long enough, maybe he'll swoop down and carry me off in his talons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick rolls his eyes and goes back into his tent.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER AND HEATHER
dialogues.text: are also watching this from their tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be so lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butt-ugly owl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They duck back into the tent. The Owl keeps watching. FADE TO BLACK. Several beats. And then in the darkness, a rustling sound A whisper that sounds like:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...see if it's alive--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK! Then Anna's hand seen--she's just turned on one of lanterns. Sits up in her sleeping bag. Listens. The sound stopped. Beat. She gets out of her bag, grabs the lantern, and goe tent flap--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and just as she steps outside-- --something strikes her hand--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --shit--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the lantern goes flying into the dirt-- --and suddenly out of the darkness come flying--

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE HANDS
dialogues.text: wielding small sharpened sticks--or are they tent pegs?-- --and they stab into Anna's belly again and again, accomp shrieks of delight. Anna screams--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's James?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA TURNS
dialogues.text: and finds she's inside the tent, wrapped tight in her sle Staring at Nick, who's propped up on his air mattress wit and a lantern, staring quizzically back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disoriented) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said the name "James."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls her sleeping bag down, looks at her belly--unma unharmed, bloodless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to scooch over next to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini is still supine, staring upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is like a regular K-mart of bad vibes, ain't it, pal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant) Please, someone, help me--

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: a static shot of dark, dark woods. The Voice continues to from somewhere deep in there:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --somebody, please!

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: It's coming from the DVD of "Blair Witch Project."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh?!?

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK FURTHER
dialogues.text: Cotter and Heather Arendt are fast asleep. Must have drif during the umpteenth viewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (much louder) Heather???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather Arendt is up like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather?? Josh???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mild snort of amusement when she sees the movie's still p the DVD. She buttons it off. Starts to lay back down--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud) Heather????

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --bolts right back up on the verge of a coronary. The Man's Voice screams:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're pulling my teeth out!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather literally punches Cotter awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha' the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clamps her hand over his mouth. Beat. They listen-- --suddenly, SCURRYING FOOTSTEPS heard; giggling--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through her hand) --o-fug-me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaaaaather???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter wrenches himself away, grabs his little 8mm camcor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared) What're you, crazy??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhilarated) What're you, nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lunges out of the tent, camera already whirring--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and right into a blinding, light-up-the-night battery o lamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halo-ed in the glare of those lights stand

dialogues.speaker: FOUR LARGE TEENAGERS
dialogues.text: in various states of grunge. They all but scream of STONE them's got a huge running Beta-Cam on shoulder, another's a DAT recorder and shotgun mic. We see Cotter from the POV of these guys camera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter shooting back at them with his puny-by-comparison his thermal long-johns halfway down his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out: Burkittsville's Funniest Home Videos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter's still shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus-Jesus-Jesus--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A furious Heather can be seen scrambling out of the tent. right in the lens:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?!?

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: The Stoner Cameraman snaps the Beta away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's 50K worth of hi-tech, chickee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave me a fucking heart attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and you boogied all the way up here to get a good night's sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just made your every dream come true, darlin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing with all this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shootin' "Blair Witch II," man-- what's your excuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting "Blair Witch II."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dude, I don't think so--that is just not happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our gig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got jurisdiction, man--we got fuckin' permits to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Let's see 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're, uh, like, in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's put it this way: one of us is going, and it's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the hassle here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Anna appear from their tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and the Brady Bunch, Mr. Scorsese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're interfering with the commerce of independent film!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter asides to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're making "Blair Witch II," too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, just give us 'til dawn and we're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, guys, we're cold, we're tired we're shook--we just want to get out of here as soon as there's light. We saw something up at Coffin Rock today--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching on) --or someone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --scared the living shit out of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I don't know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --yeah, a hand or something--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --coming out of the water--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now even Domini joins the prevarication party, popping up inside the foundation:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --stop it! Stop talking about it! I'm gonna freak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearing up) I just wanna go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't get it on tape, didja?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tried, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoner #2 starts barking orders to his crew:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strip it down and ship it out! Coffin Rock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're packed up and ready to move in a flash. Stoner #4 they trot off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any other voices or noises you hear tonight--it ain't us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stoners make Josh Leonard-like cries as they disappea into the darkness;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather??? Mike???? Somebody??? Please????

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were never seen again. Their footage was found a year later-- underexposed and useless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're the cameras doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Due for a re-load and battery check. I'll get on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Give you a hand. I think my sleep for the night just ended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, everybody grab a coat, and pull up a rock for a night of witch-watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four campers proceed to their respective tasks. Domini stays perched on the foundation, watching where th disappeared. To herself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something....really twisted...is going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up. The Owl's gone. FADE TO BLACK. Birds heard in the darkness. And snoring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuddled together, fast asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini conked out on the grass, curled in a fetal positio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ditto Heather, sprawled half-in/half-out of her sleeping Only Cotter is awake--well, making an attempt at it, anyw Squints at his digital watch: 5:45am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...wha' happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He groggily gets to his knees and dog-walks out of the te Several beats. And then we hear outside the tent:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck me! Oh, Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cries wake Heather--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --as well as Nick and Anna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --even Domini, who pops her head up and starts to ask:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happ--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and then she sees; they all see--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --they're all gone!--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --five tripods, all minus the Video cameras they used to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and none of 'em were mine! I-am-so-fucked, I-am-so-fucked-- where the hell was everybody???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asleep--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --what happened to the goddamn "Witch-watch??"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I dunno, I just woke up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --last thing I remember were those four clowns shooting the movie--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --yeah, the goddamn stoners! Who you think stole the stuff!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Got to Coffin Rock, found zip, and came back, ripped off the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini looks at one of the mangled tripods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripped? They look like they were bit off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells Like Teenage Spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is funny?? This is tens of thousands of fucking dollars! (shouts into the woods) You pricks! I'll see you in fucking court!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the only things missing, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns. Anna's at the tent door holding a pile of emp folders and two looseleaf notebooks that have somehow bee clean in half. Now Nick's incensed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's almost a year's worth of work! (into the woods) Scumbags! Oh, Jesus, Jesus....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you still have the tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One set. Everything from midnight on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --no, I think they're all in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pointing to the collapsed section of the basement f where the original "Blair Witch Project" Tapes were found The other four stop and stare at her. And then Cotter goes diving in the hole. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonovabitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And emerges with two grimy handfuls of VHS, Beta, and 8mm tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those ours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter brushes dirt from them; holds them up for inspecti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My handwriting on the face labels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then his excitement switches to confusion. Turns to D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know they were--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) --hunch. Just sort've saw 'em there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ass--you saw those four fucking baboons put 'em there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter, I think she's right. Why would those guys go to all the trouble of stealing the camera and all this other stuff and leave the tapes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were making a movie--if they were going to steal anything it'd be just the tapes, to see if we had anything they didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it was them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, who did then? Blair Witch? Snatching equipment to make her own sequel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, please keep me fucking informed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those four guys--it's the only thing that makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over at Domini, who says nothing--just stares i woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a goddamn disaster. Let's just pack it up and go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you possibly think you're going to fucking see there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea. But if that's all we've got left--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --nothing left to play 'em on, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can be goddamn sure, though, I'm going to be looking at every second of 'em when I get back to Baltimore--I get proof who stole my shit and I call the cops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ticketed to fly back from Baltimore, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I got a whole editing suite in my loft--more the fucking merrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pointless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Van pulls up to the curb in a savagely decrepit and e desolate old industrial section of North Baltimore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 403 41st Street, kids: home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno it's safe to even get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By day? No sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a great idea. Especially 'cross the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four look: a thickly wooded area that looks like most

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Druid Hill Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's its name. A pastoral glade gamboling with crackheads and homeless and averaging at least one homicide a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First enormous brick warehouse on your right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four of the five of them ride nervously in a huge, ancien that ascends in a series of jerks. Cotter's oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to be a meat-packing plant. Slaughter on the ground floor-- carcasses schlepped up on this thing for dissection and grinding and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Cotter: shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter opens the elevator grates, revealing a metal door single lock. He fits a key into it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one lock in this neighbor- hood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I need--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --throws the door wide-- --the LOUD BARKING of what sounds like a pack of pit-bull them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get inside quick, they'll stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too busy eating us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuts the door; the BARKING stops. Everyone's eyes zap 360 degrees around them: no dogs. Cotter taps a small speaker above the door;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baltimore's cheapest burglar alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He re-opens the door a crack--the BARKING starts anew. Cl Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had the door jimmied a few times. Nobody's yet made it inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ushers them into a huge

dialogues.speaker: DOUBLE-STORIED SPACE
dialogues.text: easily 30 feet high. Exposed brick walls--massive iron ro And crammed to bursting with bizarre esoterica everywhere --carousel horses, huge airplane propellers, a bowsp'rit old clipper ship, lawn jockeys, a set of bunkbeds made en wagon wheel parts, bowling balls, cannonballs, pinball ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mi casa y su casa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Su casa y shit-o hole-o.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hon'--this is what pays the rent and tuition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running a junk yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Cyber Entrepreneurialship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spend a lot of time on e-Bay. Buying, selling--sometimes buying then re-selling at substantial mark-up, sometimes just selling crap I find in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like business is booming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some stuff that's hard to part with. Editing's stuff's up there--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --he points to a loft overhanging the big room--a thin wo railing separating the work space from a sheer 20 foot dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --stairs are back through the kitchen--and a ton of bedrooms, you wanna dump your stuff or catch a nap--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter's running tape through his new video iMac. The res are gathered around the screen in various degrees of disc They look like they've been there for some time. A lot of Nick's rubbing his temples like somebody's pounding a mar inside his head. ON SCREEN: they're all watching minute after minute of no Darkness. The outlines of the Parr Foundation. Trees in t ground. Silence. Several beats as they continue to watch this stasis. Then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we get the gist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've looked at half of one tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's four other angles, man, we haven't even--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --great: we can watch Domini sleep for hours--or, shit, maybe if we stay at it for a couple of days, maybe a deer'll dash by!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For once could you just sit down, shut up, and give something a chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're leaving--case dismissed for lack of evidence. Maybe on the ride home we can figure how the fuck we're going to graduate with no thesis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere, 'til--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, chill, man--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --there's something here, Nick--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --fuck you--all off you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --he grabs Anna by the wrist and yanks her up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --now c'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your goddamn--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and suddenly Anna stops. Doubles over, clutching her ab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --oh, Jesus--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --blood can be seen soaking through her jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini, Heather and Cotter standing grimly in the Waiting Finally, they see Nick exiting a Trauma Room, looking eve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's lying on a OB/Gyn table in a johnnie, clearly seda with a face and eyes still soaked with tears. An E.R. INT (Female) is cleaning her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any number of reasons--pick one, it's as good as the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was out hiking, camping the past two days--that's what did it--I killed it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --doubtful, Mrs. Leavitt. The main thing to remember is, whatever the reason, it was for the best-- it meant something was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, this is not my field of expertise. You seem stabilized, but why take any chances? Let's keep you overnight and have the Staff obstetrician do a follow-up tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and then Anna sees what the Intern is writing on her ch To see    Boyd Kurth 5/26/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE HER HEAD
dialogues.text: she flashes on the grave marker that Domini laid on in th Burkittsville Cemetery: same name, same date.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE TRAUMA ROOM
dialogues.text: Anna yells:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Leavitt--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I'm not staying here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk to your husband--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --he's not my husband!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's flails at the Intern, trying to get up, tearing pag chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my clothes??

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. COTTER'S VAN
dialogues.text: They all sit silently as Cotter drives. The now-fully clo just sits in back like a zombie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) We'll stay overnight, get a hotel--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Cotter's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --whatever you want, no problem--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --still go see the OB in the morning--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna tosses a crumpled ball of paper into Domini's lap. S it. It's the top page of Anna's chart. Domini looks at th jotting "see Boyd Kurth--" --her head snaps up. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick. Do what she says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick tucks her into an elderly four-poster bed. Colonial Another one of Cotter's "finds."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini, Heather and Cotter gathered around his iMac, drin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something happened to Anna in Burkittsville, in the woods, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That made her lose the baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something. Someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini just shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women miscarry all the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a little nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn the tapes back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to it. Without even looking, Domini pulls the sho her shirt down, rubs something on her upper arm. Heather a good-sized burgundy-colored mark, oblong, vaguely spide shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm? I dunno. Chafing from the backpack, something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be up on your shoulder, maybe your lower back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Cotter's staring at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell. Play the goddamn tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first image that pops up is Domini sprawled out on th the Parr Foundation. Deep in REM sleep, her leg jerking l dog's. Domini sees it--a snort of embarrassed laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick bolts awake to the sound of laughter. Looks next to Anna's fast asleep. He looks relieved--then clucks to him he sees that he's fallen asleep next to her on the big ol poster with his clothes on. Starts to take off his shirt-- --and then hears the laughter again. Louder. It seems to him off. He gets out of bed, opens the door. Hisses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, knock it off, willya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's nobody there. He walks down the hallway towar kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick appears on the stairs leading into the work-loft. Se three of them huddled over the iMac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna keep it down, she's trying to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I didn't think we were making that much noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a real "funny" time for us, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) No....it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick just shakes his head, snorts with disgust. Goes back stairs--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --when he hears the laughter again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ almighty--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --he starts to storm back up the stairs to the loft-- --when he realizes he's walking away from the sound of th laughter. He stops. It's coming from the hallway--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --further down the hallway. Louder. He walks faster towar It's coming from the open door of his and Anna's bedroom. trot. Louder. Takes the corner into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the laughter stops-- --as does Anna, who appeared for a moment to be twirling around in the middle of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks down at herself and lets loose a giggle of ast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I dunno--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --you should get back into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does so. Nick once again tucks her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that you laughing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just...try and go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get dreams. I don't like 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little boys. Looking up my skirt as I danced. Giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops out two Xanax from a hospital sample bubble pack. them to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swallows them dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini's pointing to the iMac screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, what? I didn't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back it up, rewind, whatever you call it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motion. Stop there. Play it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter hits PLAY. They're watching tape from a camera tha placed almost to the ground, aimed upwards--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --there! In the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter freezes the image. The tree is so dark and so far distance of the shot, he and Heather have to put their ey up to the screen to even see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you got, telescopic vision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still don't see it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --that blur, right by that branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her finger right on the screen. Cotter quickly r --squints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, a blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you zoom it or something, make it real close, real big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the ebay Boy, remember? I can't exactly afford that kind of equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you know who can? Where do we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a blur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something there--don't ask, just trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you like just divine it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could do that, I'd be at the goddamn racetrack, not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing) I got a friend at a Lab. I could get the whole thing blown-up, enhanced--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter wearily unlocks the door to his Van. He looks all around him--finally up: There's an Owl staring down at him from a tree in Druid H across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather is bringing a cup of hot tea and 40 ounce bottle Liquor up the stairs. Sees Domini still in front of the i trying to figure out how to work the thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-to-one he dusts the keyboard for fingerprints the second he gets back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Domini the beer. Keeps the tea for herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least go drink it somewhere spilling it won't drive him to suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini gets up and slumps down on the broken-backed couch work-loft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you thought you saw on that tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elly Kedward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Elly Kedward's not the problem here, I don't think. She was just a good old-fashioned white witch--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna owe me the rest of your life, bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beta Cam's still coming back tomorrow, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Cotter flushes for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before 5:00--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --hours before--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Christ, they find out I let you have it for the weekend--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --no one'll ever know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid pauses the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you wanted enhanced?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind me asking: why the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The, uh, blur there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather has apparently gained a tad enough mastery to run through the iMac. She's playing and replaying a short section of Cotter's c tape where the bunch of them were interacting with the St Crew. She keeps seeing a FLASH on the tape. Between two trees f background. But she can't seem to freeze the image inside flash. It looks vaguely like a MIDDLE-AGED MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this look like a person stand there to you? (no response) Domini...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. Sitting on the couch where Domini was is now t clear presence of

dialogues.speaker: A MIDDLE-AGED MAN
dialogues.text: in a topcoat. He says nothing, just stares straight ahead a horrible wound in his forehead. Heather is mindboggled--and petrified. She manages to sta the word:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather's neck snaps to her right. She's sitting on that with Domini. Her eyes scan the entire loft. There's no one there but t women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK.
dialogues.text: Beat. And then in the darkness, a pack of dogs heard BARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's having trouble getting the key out of the lock. The wide open. The recorded pit-bulls bark and bark and bark.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COTTER'S WORK
dialogues.text: The barking bolts Heather and Domini up like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise Nick. Anna doesn't seem to hear it--fast asleep. As soon as Nick makes it to the door, the barking stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Domini and Heather are gathered around him like kid Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So lemme see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me get my coat off--I had eight cups of coffee, I'm wired for sound here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the tape enhanced--and I managed to sleaze a photo blow-up. Jesus, he's gonna kill me when he finds out about the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter throws her the 8"x10" blow-up of the frame. Heather looks at it, her face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still looks like a blur, only bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini grabs it. Stares at it, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend Sid said it looked like a rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Domini's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why she kills children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about witches, goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone want to tell me what's going on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and we brought it back with us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It touched me, don't you see it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She yanks down the shoulder of her shirt: the burgundy-co on her arm has grown larger and more distinct. It seems t finger-like tendrils spreading out from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its fingers! Here. And here--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --she yanks down the front of her shirt: there's another mark there--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and here and here and here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls back her hair: there are two more growing on th her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how to stop it! I don't know how to kill it! But it's here right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini's head is in her hands. She's hyperventilating. He her arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow it down, slow it down, whatever it is, we'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why she kills children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look up. Anna's standing in the doorway looking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They put their palms in the blood. And then they press them on your skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Anna walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini's lying down, Heather beside her. She's drinking a seems much calmer--though she's got an afghan cinched aro entire body, toes to chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No big deal. I'm just trying to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some more beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) I think you closed the bar again. I'll have to go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the store. When you get back, I'll try to make sense of it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather gets up, starts for the door. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you afraid's going to happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That they'll start touching us inside our heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather sticks two six packs inside a car. Double thinks. back and grabs two more.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE REGISTER
dialogues.text: Heather waits in line. She sees that across the street is Hill Park. Stares aimlessly into the woods, chewing on a nail. She looks seriously worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather shifts her gaze to the Check-Out Clerk--and she s Standing behind the Clerk is

dialogues.speaker: THE MIDDLE-AGED MAN
dialogues.text: she saw in the loft, with the wound in his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather's eyes dart back to the Clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather's eyes dance around the deli. The Man is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just outside--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather stands at a payphone by the curb. We hear ringing other end. Finally a pick-up. But an OPERATOR'S VOICE is first:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a collect call from Heather. Will you accept the charges?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long beat on the other end. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Operator clicks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just calling, I know it's been a long time--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --what do you need this time, Heather?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's nothing like that. I just wanted to know if Dad--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a sound on the other line of the phone dropping, bangin floor or against a wall--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Mom...? Mom??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a Voice comes back on the line. But it's MALE now:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants me to talk to you, Heather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother's pastor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to my Dad??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was an accident early this morning. Another car. Your father's injuries were fatal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell your mother not to expect you at the funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone clicks dead on the other end. Heather lets the just drop and begins walking, leaving her two bags of bee sidewalk, in a daze. And then she starts running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather's banging like crazy on the door to the loft. Finally, she hears the sound of Cotter snapping open the He opens the door. The recorded dogs bark. Heather slams behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Domini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My room, asleep, last I checked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather barges past him and towards Cotter's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather walks in. The bed's empty. The afghan's lying in the floor-- --along with all of the clothing Domini last had on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't bother calling her name again, there's nobody room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Cotter look up at Heather, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she's got to be somewhere here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's been in or out since you left. Would've heard the dogs.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Heather dashing up the stairs into the work-loft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Cotter poking through the two hallway closets. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Nick looking in the closet and under the bed of his and A bedroom. Nobody. Anna sleeps through it all.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Heather really starting to lose it. Rampaging through the room, pushing aside all of Cotter's huge carousel animals behind those things she can't move, dumping things willy- the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini!!!!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Cotter helping Heather open one of the windows in the big Looking out on the ledge. Looking down to the sidewalk, f stories below. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire escape??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather screams out the window:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominiiiiiiii!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, Anna and Cotter sit at the table nervously. Heat literally shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She would've had to have a key, anyway, to lock the deadbolt behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she got out of here some- how because she's not here!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parents. She might've called--

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: Heather on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taos, New Mexico. The Sheriff's Office, please....thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up. Picks back up. Punches in a number in a blu Someone picks up on the other end:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Sheriff's Office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! I need to speak to Sheriff Von Teer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in a meeting. Could I have him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it's urgent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I tell him what it's regarding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His daughter, for God's sake-- I need to know if he's heard from her this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat on the other line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the Sheriff is a widower. They never had any children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather is struck dumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....Ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking to Taos, New Mexico--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --yes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the Sheriff's Office--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --yes, Ma'am, can I help you with anything else?--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --his name's Von Teer! His daughter's named Domini!--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --thank you for calling--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes dead. The three of them just stand there, staring at each other petrified. And then Anna walks in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad she's dead. She brought the thing that killed my child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather sits at the table alone, staring at the 8x10 that made for Domini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see here that I can't see, damnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs a finger down the length of the blur in the bran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it that scared you so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters, heads for the blotched, '60s vintage Mr. Cof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally got her back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, what you should do is get her back up and get her to a goddamn doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you don't think I know that? You don't think I've tried? She won't fucking go-- she won't leave this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's off her fucking rocker--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. It's...alright. We're all a little--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Hypothetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think....there could've been something up in those woods that Anna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
