dialogues.text: --it's not a could've--there was, Nick. And it fucked up Anna, and did something to Domini, and it caused my father to die, and it's here with us in this place now. And I don't have one single idea in hell what's going to happen next, just that it's going to happen to one of us. And then the other. And then the other. It's going to get into our brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Heather finally loses it and starts weeping--great wr sobs. Nick's a little awkward at first how to comfort her just starts lightly massaging her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's explanations. Rational explanations for everything that's happened. We'll drive ourselves crazy if we keep obsessing on supernatural what-ifs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That feels good. Lower--down into my neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick moves his hands down-- --and somehow the two of them are then guiding his hands her blouse, onto her breasts-- --and she's moaning, and grabbing hard onto his hair-- --and pulling his whole head down to hers. And their lips tongues meet, and they're biting each other like animals- --and his hands are yanking and twisting hard on her brea between her legs-- --and she's literally clawing him with her fingernails, d blood down the length of his chest-- --until she reaches a burgundy-colored mark right at his with tendrils like fingers-- --SNAP!--it's like someone woke them from a dream. They b at each other, baffled--what the hell just happened? But a dream. Nick's chest is streaming blood; there's blood o Heather's lips-- --matching the color of the mark on Nick's waist, and the Heather now sees inside her elbow. They both move away from each other, uncomprehending--and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick pacing the floor as Anna lies in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what it is, but there is something happening here, and it's starting to scare the living shit out me, and look, I'm just not going to argue the point anymore--you want to stay here, stay, but I've got to get the fuck out of here, and I'm begging you to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm going--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --no, you're not. You love me too much. You don't want to see them kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter's behind the iMac, screening tape millimeter by mi downing one Coke after another. He's so caffed-out, both and his voice is shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could be something right here, do you think it's some- thing, Heather--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather doesn't even look up. She's just sitting on the b backed couch staring at Domini's 8"x10".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --but that could be just a shadow, I think it's a shadow, it's nothing, Heather, do you think it's nothing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and he just keeps prattling on oblivious, eyes fixed on moving at a snail's pace in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about the tree, it's something about the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts it down on a cushion and snatches up the dog-ear the "Blair Witch Dossier." Easily flips to the page Domin her: Elly Kedward trussed in the wagon in the woods. Flips backwards in the book, looking for something--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the goddamn tree, Domini, for chrissake, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and then she stops on the page that shows the anthropol students' sketch of the Parr foundation; the skinny littl in the middle-- --then back to the woodcut of Elly Kedward in the woods-- --then back to Domini's photo of the foundation--the huge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same trees. They took Elly Kedward out to the same kind of trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still oblivious) --I look and look in the tree, all I ever see, he's always there watching, that stupid owl, over and over--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Cotter, where can I get on-line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --anywhere, anywhere, all up and live, all the time--fucking owl--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather slips in front of one of Cotter's PC's.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: Heather on-line, in the middle of Blair Witch Chat Room, WICCA GIRL: anybody know where tree is they tied Elly Kedward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. And then a response. COFFIN ROX: Black Hills Heather responds, types: WICCA GIRL: thanx--anybody know where??? in Hills Beat. Response: TREACLE-TREACLE-LITTLE-EILEEN: My two cts? By Rusty Parr' house hadda be that close how else could she whisper into his ear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather stops typing; absorbs this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking owl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's possible the tree in the Parr foundation is the same one they tied Elly Kedward to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea--goddamitt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then suddenly another response appears in the Chat Ro COFFIN ROX: Check BW Cult book, 1809--they have full account

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather grunts. Types back: WICCA GIRL: 1 copy in exist. you got it? COFFIN ROX: no just seen it WICCA GIRL: where COFFIN ROX: one of us WICCA GIRL: if you're out there and got it anybody, contact me this mailbx urgent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COFFIN ROX: location described pretty good in section bout first boys disappeared afer Elly dies - James Kurth & another kid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather stops typing. To herself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy Kurth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, does that look like Domini there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather doesn't look up from her screen. Impatient, tryin pieces that don't fit together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down there in the Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather looks up. Cotter is looking down through the big huge windows; he's waving to someone. Heather gets up. Slowly peers over the loft railing. Squi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stark-naked Domini is standing in Druid Hill Park. Look them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather and Cotter's pace slows drastically as they try a navigate the overgrown pathways inside the Park. The flor below and above--moonlight barely penetrates where they'r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter puts a finger to her lip. Whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the place you want to announce your arrival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's she going to know where to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --things got a way of finding you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's freezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time try putting on shoes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the two of them stop dead in their tracks. Through the ahead of them they can see a clearing. Illuminated by the what appears to be an old

dialogues.speaker: WOODEN OX CART
dialogues.text: with SNOW drifted up nearly to the hubs of its wheels.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER AND COTTER
dialogues.text: are suddenly so cold they can see their breath in the air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck--??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her hand and pulls her through the thicket. They

dialogues.speaker: THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: the snow is now gone. Where the cart was is now just a st rotting cut brush. A clean-up effort someone must have st then abandoned. Heather and Cotter stare at each other, b and not a little afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon trying to shoot down through all these trees--can make things funky--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I saw what I saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cart they brought Elly Kedward into the woods with--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --into the Black Hills with--200- something miles from here--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Domini!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both see it at the same time:

dialogues.speaker: A NAKED WHITE BODY
dialogues.text: face down at the base of a tree. Heather races over, knee next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, what happened, are you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and Heather lets out a screech. The face of the body re ELDERLY MALE. Filthy, tongue lolling black out of its mou been dead for some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be it still alive, James?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather turns--

dialogues.speaker: A PACK OF LITTLE BOYS
dialogues.text: wild-eyed and wielding sticks, RUSH AT HEATHER--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --then finish the job, lads!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Heather screeches again, throws up her arms to protect

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather looks up: Cotter's lying on the ground, holding h bleeding forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you do that for??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather looks at her hand. She's clenching a sharp stick The Little Boys are gone. The body of the Dead Man is not

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his hand, pulls him up. They start running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather and Cotter at the table, still out of breath and as they tell Nick what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and one of the little boys, his name was James. As in the boy James Kurth--the first child to disappear from the town of Blair after they banished Elly Kedward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of alarm comes to Nick's face. But he says nothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno it's anything. It's a name Anna's mentioned--from her dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't handle this anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He produces a large, thick spliff and torches it up. Big passes it to Heather, who takes an even bigger one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much of that stuff you guys been smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to keep sane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to make shapes and shadows in the dark into something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, chemicals, fear, sleep- deprivation--and a round-the-clock obsession with the occult--hell've a recipe for a mind-fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except we seem about 18 times more together than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather spit-takes a lung-full of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd strongly advise you to join us--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --before you lose your emotional lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Yeah, what the hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the joint, sucks in mightily--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atta boy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and then the whole kitchen seems to explode-- --GLASS and MULLIONS from the big window in the room come in shards at them-- --and then when the noise finally stops, and the flying d all hit the floor, they all look down and see:

dialogues.speaker: A HORNED OWL
dialogues.text: broken and bleeding from its header through the window. S and then dying. Eyes wide, staring up at them. No one says a word. They just look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of chairs, but nobody's sitting down. Cotter, Heath Nick all look like their nerves are fraying down to bare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are being fucked with here, someone or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why in the world would she--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --why in the world would she just fly the coop in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chrissake: why any of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's going anywhere--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --hell, I don't think I'm ever leaving this place again--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --one of us, all of us--I have no idea--brought whatever this thing is back here. We're not going to go out there and spread it around like Typhoid Mary. We're gonna figure it out, we're gonna bring a goddamn end to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domini's the only logical explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not dealing with fucking logic here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Domini, it's not Domini, I don't care--all I know is I'm not dealing with something--anything-- snuffing me in my sleep. I want to do what we did in the woods-- surveillance of this whole place 24/7, with somebody monitoring those cameras every second. There's something, somebody here, I want to see 'em coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought all your equipment got stolen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the shit that was worth anything, yes. You'd be amazed, though, what you can get free on the 'net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens a desk drawer--there must be a dozen little palm corders in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Cotter lacks in other equipment, he makes up for wit huge SPOOLS of it--and he's running it from the various t cams to a motley bank of monitors he's set up on the kitc

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: duct-tapes one of the little units on the top of a closet frame in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: sees he has an excellent angle on the front door/elevator

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: watches half asleep and befuddled in their bedroom as Nic camera on a jerry-rigged broom-handle tripod.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: connects the cables in the kitchen--sees Anna and a clear the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: collaborate on installing a camera from Cotter's work-lof provides a view of the dark area under the work-loft. Nic the camera on a rope, while Heather guides and supports t attached.

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: watches the camera descend on one of the monitors. Satisf view it's giving him, he yells:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good! Tie it off!

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE WORK-LOFT
dialogues.text: Nick does so. Ties the rope securely around the loft rail a slip knot in the loose end and lassoes it over one of t beams above to keep it from being a hazard. He has to jum the rope as it comes down again from the beam-- --stumbles backwards slightly as he catches it-- --hitting the spindly loft railing-- --which suddenly SNAPS! And Nick goes tumbling out into mid-air, the slip-knot in in his hand the only thing keeping him from plummeting 20 the floor below--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Jee-zus!!!--

dialogues.speaker: COTTER
dialogues.text: sees it happen on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Christ!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dashes out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE WORK-LOFT
dialogues.text: Heather is trying to lift Nick back up by the rope by she physical strength she doesn't have--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't! You're making me lose my grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming! I'm coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Cotter comes dashing in with a tall metal step ladder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter splays the ladder open, starts clambering up it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let it go, I've got you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you nuts--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it's less than four feet, just--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --shit!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick loses his grip--starts falling-- --Cotter snatches hold of him as he falls, pinning Nick b ladder and his torso. The ladder wobbles precariously--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --don't move, don't even breathe--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and then the ladder finally comes to a stable rest. Nick is savagely shaken as he slowly climbs down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesusjesusjesus....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ditto Cotter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah--please don't do that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giggle is heard from the doorway to the big room. They

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: is standing there, laughing with her hand against her mou little child. She sing-songs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could see up your dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter, Heather and Nick watch the monitors on the table silence. Drinking coffee. They all look majorly exhausted of them look in any immediate danger of falling asleep. T dart from monitor to monitor, relievedly seeing nothing-- Anna tossing restlessly in bed. Heather sees that Nick is massaging something on his fore making him wince. Without a word, she rolls his sleeve up A wine-colored mark that looks vaguely like a jagged J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gothic rune--the letter "S."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a blood blister--or a bruise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be that blue collar life we all lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter pulls up his pant leg: two blurry burgundy marks-- shapes overlapping each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a "j."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For "James?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes right along with these two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls back her hair--where jaw meets neck: two smudge that together look like badly-drawn lowercase "n"s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put 'em together that's a "k." James Kurth--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --or Lyme Disease or poison sumac, or God knows what-else we could have picked up in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what we picked up in the woods--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and then there's a sharp knock at the door. All three sets of eyes zoom towards the sound, but no one The knocking grows louder, more insistent. Still, they re frozen. Frightened. They look at the monitor giving an angle of the door/elev Nothing can be seen--just a dark blur in the door's peeph indicating someone's standing in the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one ever comes here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have to open the door to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knocking increases, along with muffled shouts of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter...? Cotter...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter gets up and slowly walks to the door. The rapping shouting increasing in volume with each step. Finally, a deep breath. And then Cotter looks through the hole. He sees:

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: his Techie friend from the Film Lab glowering back at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're in there, you piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) You have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until I get that Beta Cam back! We're both in a world of shit here!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my fucking job, man!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid starts knocking again. Cotter walks back to the kitchen. Sits down in front of t monitors. Watches as the knocking continues. Finally stop expression on Cotter's face never changes.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: So quiet, so tense, they can hear the clocks ticking all loft: 4:10a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should check on Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the monitor, she's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's far from "fine."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're needed here--keep watching--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --f'chrissake, Heather, it's not like the two of us are gonna doze off he leaves for two seconds--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I don't trust anybody, not even me, anymore--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --shhhh! #5, there's something up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes all go to the Monitor with the view of Cotter' loft. Beat. They freeze. A slight WHIRRING--then slow WHOOSHING heard. Movement se darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the printers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We all go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --fuck Anna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotter handing a sheaf of print-outs to Heather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it's for you. Came through email. How it started printing without a command, though--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather looks up at them in astonishment; dithered:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it's the "Blair Witch Cult"--a copy-- some pages from--one of them on the site must've gotten my message--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't say--it's just these pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to make out the ancient, smeared scrawls of thi 200 year old book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "taken by the witch as they were marked by her--first Jamie Kurth when the stain appeared on his brow that next summer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the next page is illegible, Heather flips forward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "for t'was said he and Jon Edmunds and other boys who found Elly Kedward still on her tree in the snow. Poking her with sticks finding her still living. Taking her bonds and noosing them to her neck, hanging her from her tree until she perished."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather looks up at the others in wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the little boys. Elly Kedward didn't die from "exposure" out there: she was executed. (resumes reading) "Killing Elly Kedward, but not the witch herself, who floated from the mortal husk--"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather looks up; she echoes Domini's words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It's why the witch kills children."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought all witches were benign and good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather tries to rouse Anna in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to talk to me, talk to me about the dreams--about James, the other boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...I don't understand them myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try, please, Anna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --bad boys, mean boys, cowardly boys--just like Domini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coward too. That's why she had to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to her, where did she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know--just that she was afraid--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Anna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My eye, is there something in my eye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer. Lift the lid and look-- it hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather lifts Anna's eyelid, gets close to her face and l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Anna gently guides Heather's face down. Begins stroki the next thing Heather knows, her body is gravitating tow Anna's. She's kissing her, stroking and fondling her as A her fingers. The News camera zooms in on t body of Domini crumpled in that closet, visible rope burn neck. Seen: Nick's confession.
